fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5189].
  {panel}

I may have missed this, but I can't find a way to define the order of values for "Status"

I'm adding new statuses to JIRA in order to match our workflow. For example, I have "New" status (which will precede the "Open" status). 

However, if I order issues in JIRA by their status, issues are ordered as "Open" > "New" > "In Progress" > "Resolved" 

I'd need to be able to specify the order ("New" > "Open" > "In Progress" > "Resolved") for the status field (same way as priorities, resolutions and issue types can be ordered)

Note: Workaround from the comments also documented in [How to re-order statuses|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+re-order+statuses]. This workaround does not apply to OnDemand customers.
fields.summary: Define status order

fields.description: It would be nice if it was possible to exclude an user that edits, comments or changes an issue from receiving an email notification no matter what the notification scheme is set up to.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5185].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 20 February 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your feedback. The JIRA product management team is working to make jira.atlassian.com a more valuable service by ensuring it accurately reflects the relative prioritization of feature requests. Remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of the many sources of feedback we use when planning the JIRA roadmap. For more details, [please read our post on the subject|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

With that said, we have chosen to close this issue. While we recognize that it would be valuable in a number of use cases, we have not been able to prioritize this issue for the past 10 years and do not expect this to change in the foreseeable future.

There are a number of ways to achieve recurring issues in JIRA:
 * [TheScheduler|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/pl.com.tt.jira.plugin.theschedulerpro], available for JIRA Server.
 * [Recurring Tasks|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.gebsun.atlassian.rtasks], available for JIRA Cloud.
 * Simply clone issues issues prior to closing them. You can also automate this with the [Create Issue on Transition add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.jira.cot].
 * Use any kind of scripting tool, like a Cron job, and create issues via the [JIRA REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/api-reference].
 * There are a number of discussions of different strategies on Atlassian Answers [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/80032/recurring-jira-issues], [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/69329/periodic-tasks-in-jira?page=1#69368], [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/66154/how-do-you-automatically-set-recurring-issues], and [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/75358/recurring-issues].

I recognize that this may come as disappointing news. Please remember that our goal is to make jira.atlassian.com more useful to you by ensuring that the every open suggestion is something we truly plan to implement.

As always, please do not hesitate to contact me with questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
*Original request*

If JIRA is used as a task tracker, it would be useful if one could schedule the periodic creation of an issue (aka task), for instance, "Reboot server" every Monday. The 'issue created' email would act as the notification to the user when the issue was (automatically) created. Alternatively, a single issue could cycle through a workflow, with an email notification on the initial state.
fields.summary: Recurring issues

fields.summary: Move Issue - Ensure that issue is autoassigned if mover does not have Assign issue permission

fields.description:
Correct and useful behaviour:
1) Open an Issue.
2) Choose Operation "Assign this issue"
3) Select a new user as assignee, - hit "OK".

Both the CURRENT assignee and the NEW assignee are both sent a notification email because we have a notification scheme with:
Event: "Issue Assigned" and Notification: "Current Assignee".

This is all great! 

Problem:
1) 
2) Instead of using the Operation "Assign this issue", use the operation "Edit this issue".
3) Select a new user as assignee, - hit "Update".

Result: ONLY the CURRENT assignee is sent an email.  The NEW assignee is not sent an email.  This is not expected or useful behaviour.

I have verified this problem by looking in the Mail Queue in the Administration area as soon as the email are generated.  Only 1 email is generated via the Edit operation, while 2 are generated via the Assignee operation.

thanks,
fields.summary: Assignee Change on "Edit Issue" - no notification is sent to the new assignee.

fields.description:
If you create a filter that includes a specific user or specific reporter, then create a two-dimensional portlet based upon that filter, the drill-down results will be incorrect when you reach IssueNavigator.

The problem is in UserParameter.  Specifically, when you call SearchRequest.getQueryString() in the velocity template, if you have specified a user or reporter by name in your filter then UserParameter.getQueryString will be called and will return &assigneeSelect=<username> or &reporterSelect=<username>, instead of &assigneeSelect=specificuser&assignee=<username> or &reporterSelect=specificuser&reporter=<username>.  This causes the assignee/reporter to be ignored, so you will get too many results when you drill down on the portlet.
fields.summary: Two dimensional stats portlet yields incorrect search results in certain cases

fields.description: It would be nice if you could create templates with certain field already populated with specific data.

fields.description:
From version 3.0.0 onward, JIRA enters actual user as sender in the email notifications (instead of using a predefined e-mail address). This means that sender field can now contain non-ASCII characters, as user's "fullname" is used as the description part of the email address. Unfortunately, the field is encoded incorrectly, as it is always encoded in ISO-646. 

Strangely, the subject field ("Subject:") is correctly encoded in UTF-8... It seems as if somebody forgot to properly encode "From:" field.

Relevant parts of the e-mail header from JIRA:
------
From: =?ISO646-US?Q?Bo=3Ftjan_Dolenc_=28JIRA=29?= <jira.razvoj@marand.si>
Subject: =?utf-8?Q?[JIRA]_Created=3A_=28PE=2D27=29_test_=C5=A1umnikov_v_emailu?=
To: bostjan.dolenc@Uni-Lj.si
------
fields.summary: non-ASCII characters incorrectly encoded in field "From:" in emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5174].
  {panel}

At various points in JIRA, one chooses a recipient for some form of email notification:

 - Notification schemes
 - Watchers
 - Filter subscriptions

Currently only individuals can 'watch' an issue, and only individuals or groups can subscribe to a filter.  It would be nice if one could choose any valid recipient (reporter, assignee, random email, single user) for each of these.  This might involve extracting out common code into a Recipients object.
fields.summary: Create "email recipient" object for use in watches, notifications and subscriptions

fields.description:
JIRA generates vast amounts of useless SQL for most operations.  For every valid line of SQL, there are:

 - three SET autocommit statements
 - a commit
 - a rollback immediately after

Typical output looks like:

                   1757 Query       commit
                   1757 Query       rollback
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=1
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=1
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=0
                   1757 Query       SELECT ID, LINKTYPE, SOURCE, DESTINATION, SEQUENCE FROM issuelink WHERE SOURCE=10020
                   1757 Query       commit
                   1757 Query       rollback
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=1
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=1
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=0
                   1757 Query       SELECT SOURCE_NODE_ID, SOURCE_NODE_ENTITY, SINK_NODE_ID, SINK_NODE_ENTITY, ASSOCIATION_TYPE, SEQUENCE FROM nodeassociation WHERE SOURCE_NODE_ID=10000 AND SOURCE_NODE_ENTITY='Project' AND SINK_NODE_ENTITY='VersionControl' AND ASSOCIATION_TYPE='ProjectVersionControl'
                   1757 Query       commit
                   1757 Query       rollback
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=1
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=1
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=0
                   1757 Query       SELECT ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, actionbody, CREATED, actionnum FROM jiraaction WHERE issueid=10020 AND actiontype='comment'
                   1757 Query       commit
                   1757 Query       rollback
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=1
041109 10:01:28    1757 Query       SET autocommit=1
                   1757 Query       SET autocommit=0


Creating an issue generates 657 SQL queries, of which 540 are useless (commits, rollbacks, sets).  Of the remaining 117, 44 are duplicates of queries made earlier (a separate issue).

It is hard to tell what effect on performance all this has.  One hopes that databases run these statements very quickly.  MySQL takes 0.3ms per set of (commit,rollback,3 x set), amounting to 32ms for the insert.  The increase in network overhead is probably a lot more significant.
fields.summary: Avoid generating useless SQL rollback and commit queries

fields.description: The Configure your Issue Navigator option on every filter takes a very long time to open the screen the first time any user hits the page per user session. reproduce: So user a tries to configure their issue navigator. System spends 5+ minutes opening screen. User configures their issue navigator and goes back to filter. User then manages filters and adds a column order. Issue Navigator column config screen appears instantly. User then logs out. User logs back in, views same filter, clicks 'Configure your Issue Navigator' and has same 5+ minute wait. ... I believe that the problem is that the default behavior for the 'Configure your Issue Navigator' is to first select on all issues in the system, then to present the user with the last 5 issues or so of the select on the configure screen. It would be very nice if this default behavior were changed, if this is infact the problem.
fields.summary: Configure your Issue Navigator very very very very slow

fields.description:
It looks like the Jelly CreateIssue tag is unable to set the issue security level.  The following tag ought to do it, if a security level called 'Low' is defined:

<jira:CreateIssue project-key="TP" summary="Issue summary 1" description="" issueType="Bug" priority="Blocker" security-level="Low"/>

When run, the issue is created, but no security level is set.  If the security level field is 'required', then one gets an error, "Security Level is required. The "Set Issue Security" permission is required in order to set this field."
fields.summary: Jelly CreateIssue tag does not set issue security level

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

When 2 users try working on same issue at same time one of the users who is trying to modify a stale version of issue will get a very ugly error screen with no clear indication of the cause of the error.

use case:
(assume both users have permission to modify X-1)

0. issue X-1 is in Open state
1. user1 opens issue X-1
2. user2 opens issue X-1
3. user1 updates X-1 by clicking on Start Progress action
4. user2 is not aware of user1 clicking Start Progress, user2 has not reloaded the web page view of X-1, so the issue still appears as Open. user2 tries to start progress also.
At this point user2 gets ugly error screen.
Instead user2 should get a polite message informing him/her that the issue has been modified by another person and that it should be reloaded in the browser before proceeding with changes.
fields.summary: concurrent modification of issue but 2 people causes error screen

fields.description:
Many JIRA permissions only take effect if something else in the system is enabled/configured:

If timetracking is disabled, "Work On Issues" has no effect.
If attachments are disabled, "Create Attachments" has no effect.
If voting/watching is disabled, "View Voters and Watchers" has no effect.
If issue linking is disabled, "Link Issues" has no effect.
If there are no security levels, "Set Issue Security" is irrelevant.
If there are no CVS modules, "View Version Control" is irrelevant.

It would be nice if such permissions were greyed out (but still changeable/operational), as a visual hint (perhaps with rollover/text explanation) that changes will have no effect until something else is done.  For some reason, half of JIRA's functionality is switched off by default, and after "enabling" it in the permission scheme, users get confused as to why feature X still doesn't work.
fields.summary: Visually disable permissions if not applicable

fields.description:
In JIRA 3, a number of people have complained that they can't see how to associate a field layout scheme with a project. In 3, schemes are specified in one place, *except* for the field layout schemes:

Key:  JSP
URL: No URL
Lead: Anton Mazkovoi
Default Assignee: Unassigned
Notification Scheme: JIRA Notifcations ( select scheme | edit notifications )
Permission Scheme: Default Permission Scheme ( select scheme | edit permissions )
Issue Security Scheme: Default Issue Security Scheme ( select scheme | edit issue security levels )
Workflow Scheme: None ( select scheme )
CVS Modules: None ( select modules )
Mail Configuration: Mail notifications from this project will come from 'jira-support-system@atlassian.com' ( edit configuration )
Project Category: None ( select category )


Field layout schemes are specified right at the bottom of the page, below the version list (generally where people need to scroll to find it).

This could be fixed just by reordering the elements, putting field layout schemes below the other schemes.
fields.summary: UI bug: field layout scheme hard to find on project admin page
Eliminate Glue dependency

fields.summary: All link problem in the issue page

fields.description:
I upgraded to 3.0 #74 (3.02), from 2.2 #51.
Since I did that I can no longer move issues between projects.  When I try to do that, I sit at page 2, and it never takes the input, it just refreshes the screen.
I have verified the permissions between the two projects.  And I have full permissions for both projects (same permission scheme).  I'm the jira-administrator, so I have give myself full permissions.  

I have checked catalina.out, doing as tail on the log while performing the actions to move the issue, there is no error in the log.  

Between the two projects, project A, the old project has only the default required fields, while project B, the new project, has more required fields, which do indeed appear on the move screen, and are being filled out. 

I also tried cloning an issue, and moving to cloned issue.  That does not work.
I tried moving an issue from Project A to Project C, where Project A and Project C have the same required fields, and move has worked all along (up until the migration).  That is not working either.  In every case I'm stuck on "Step 2 of 3: Update the fields of the issue to relate to the new project"

What else should I try?
fields.summary: Can't move issues between projects since upgradign to 3.0.2

fields.description:
i am trying to create a new workflow by copying from the default jira one.
once i am in the Copy Workflow page, i clicked on the Copy button.  what should
i expect to see after that?  i thought the copy function would create a copy of the
workflow but i don't see it.
fields.summary: copying workflow

fields.description:
When doing a release, JIRA asks to move any open issues to another version. After doing so, the change history of the moved files doesn't show this change. 

So, in effect, after mistakingly :-/ having moved all open issues to the wrong version, the only way to put them back onto the right version is by restoring a backup.
fields.summary: Moved issues due to release miss change history

fields.description:
annoying problem.
If description field is required then you cannot progress past step 3 as there is no way to set a description while moving an issue.

If assignee is set to 'automatic' and there are no component leads and no component lead assignees then you get stuck in step 4 if you disable unassigned issues. The prog doesn't seem to default to the project lead in this case.


the biggest problem with these scenerios is that the user is just faced with the same screen and no error message. It's difficult to determine what went wrong.



This isn't the right place, but I'm gonna mention it anyway - it'd be nice to be able to 'force' a new state for all moved issues at the admin level. To enable this in my copy I modified the com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.enterprise.MoveIssueUpdateWorkflow and hard-coded a string in there. But it'd be nice to do it from the admin gui.

-wc
fields.summary: Move Issue Problems - Stuck in step 3 at times, step 4 other times

fields.description:
The move issue operation will fail silently if the fields:

Due Date
Description
Environment

are required in the target field layout scheme.

Need to pass the original values through to validate or provide user with ability to set these fields if the orginal issue does not contain values for these fields.

At present, as the move operation does not cater for these fields, the validation of required fields fails - but the error message does not have a field in which it can be displayed.
fields.summary: Move Issue - required fields causes silent failure.

fields.description:
From Ilya Pogorelsky:

reproduce steps:

1. Setup list of saved filters on dashboard
2. Go to Find Issues   
3. Select AAA project - note that fix versions are AV1, AV2 etc
4. Run the report
5. Go to dashboard and select BBB Whatever filter
6. in the issue navigator screen click on Edit filter
7. Now note that project is BBB but fix versions are still AV1, AV2, selecting another project and then BBB in the drop down finally
+correctly refreshes the list.

I believe this can be generalized to any 2 different projects.

this is also a problem in 3.0.2 version of jira
fields.summary: Incorrect caching of version when switching between filters

fields.summary: Update docs to reflect CreateIssueHandler's assigning capabilities

issue.field.timeestimate:   	 
issue.field.timespent:   	
issue.field.originalestimation:

instead of a real text. The strings are missing in the *.properties files.

multi-byte language utf-8 encode and calendar datepicker problem analyze and resolve

fields.description: We have a project set up to create issues from email. This particular project leaves issues unassigned by default. However, if someone sends a message to the new issue inbox and cc's someone else, that other person will become the assignee. I looked in the doc and didn't see anything about assigning issues based on cc.
fields.summary: Create Issue handler incorrectly assigns to cc:

fields.description: The Filter portlet only allows to select the user-defined filters. But on many occasions i would have wished the standard-filters to be available, like "ALL", "Recently updated", "recently solved", etc...
fields.summary: Make the Standard-Filters(All, recently solved, etc.) available for Portlets

fields.description:
Today we have portlets, which can display small lists using a specified filter. 

It would be great to be able to define the columns which the portlet should display or give the opportunity to exchange the last 2 columns.
fields.summary: Filter Portlet with configurable columns
Automatic Dashboard Update every x Minutes

fields.description:
ok... How do I create one of these?  I've downloaded you sample custom fields, and I've been trying for days to get a date time one.  The date time selector from dynarch is a great little plugin, but for the life of me, I can't seem to get all the pieces of the puzzle to fit.

I have a custom field (based on the existing datetime field) that calls a new js function: show_calendar3 (which I created in date_picker.jsp).  I am trying to get this new function to call a new jsp file CalendarTime which I can change the settings of the calendar component to include time, and format the string properly...  

However, I am stuck with this error:  HTTP Status 404 - Could not execute action [CalendarTime]:Action 'popups.CalendarTime' not found or could not be initialized: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: popups.CalendarTime<...

I added the new action in actions.xml ( located in atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes )

	<action name="popups.CalendarTime" alias="CalendarTime">
		<view name="input">/secure/popups/calendartime.jsp</view>
		<view name="success">/secure/popups/calendartime.jsp</view>
	</action>


What else am I missing?  Or, am I even in the right ballpark on how to do this?
fields.summary: Date Time Custom Field

fields.description:
We are get the same error as JRA-4936 under 3.0.2 Professional:
After setting up JIRA on Tomcat5, we go to the URL:
Http://localhost:8080/jira
This redirects us to the setup screen.  After filling the information fields, including our license, clicking Next yields the following message:

"Could not activate indexing: Cannot activate indexing as it is already active."

The path is set to "C:\atlassian\atlassian-jira-professional-3.0.2\indexes", and the folder is created successfully.  We appear to have the newest professional version (#72).  Was the fix in JRA-4936 applied in this version besides Standard?
fields.summary: Could not activate indexing on Setup screen

fields.description: Today it is not possible to set the reporter to anybody else than the person logged on. A nice feature would be to be able to set the reporter to a different user. For example if a bug is phoned in, and I have to add it to jira. Then it would be correct to set the person calling as reporter.
fields.summary: Specify / set reporter

fields.description:
Using the XML-RPC soap interface to Jira 3.0.2 from .NET, I get an error when retrieving an issue. The error is due to a null due date. The WSDL says the duedate can not be null. I'm not sure the solution is to make the element nillable since .NET doesn't handle null dateTimes.

Here is a segment of the WSDL:

<xsd:complexType name='RemoteIssue'>
  <xsd:complexContent>
    <xsd:extension base='n11:AbstractRemoteEntity'>
      <xsd:all>
        <xsd:element name='key' nillable='true' type='xsd:string' />
        <xsd:element name='summary' nillable='true' type='xsd:string' />

fields.description:
When we are generating XL report of the issues from the navigator, I would like to have resolved dates of the issues also in the report. 

We are getting the updated date. But it does not serve our purpose. Because an issue may me resolved on some date but the issue is being closed on some other date after verification. By this the updated date is having the closed date. Some times if some comment is added after the resolution of the issue, the updated date will be the comment date.

The resolved date I am not able to get.

Can you please suggest some solution for my problem as early as possible.
fields.summary: wanted resolved date of all issues when we generate XL report from navigator

fields.description:
My SMTP mail server "From address" is set to "TELS Issuetracker <issuetracker@telscenter.org>".  When I click Update, JIRA accepts it without reservation.

I click "Send a Test Email" and the log reports that it succeeded.  I also receive it at the specified address.

But when a notification takes place that must send an e-mail, it fails with this error:
2004-10-15 17:19:48,894 ERROR [atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl] com.atlassian.mail.MailException: Sending failed;
  nested exception is: 
        javax.mail.internet.AddressException: Missing '<' in string ``"Turadg Aleahmad (JIRA)" <TELS Issue
tracker <issuetracker@telscenter.org>>'' at position 73

"Send Test Email" should address the e-mail the same way so it actually tests the addressing.

Further, I would request that the address composer does not prepend "First Last (JIRA) <" to a "From address" if it already matches the "[\w ]+ <.*@.*>" pattern.

If that's too much, at least make the "From address" field validate its contents.
fields.summary: Email notifications fail if SMTP Server From address includes a name

fields.description:
I was reading http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/quicksearch.html this morning, it's amazing what cool features one finds when one actually reads the docs... :)

Anyway, I was trying it out, and I thought of one additional element that might be extremely useful: Fix Version

It'd be great to be able to search for like so:

"My open 5.2.3"

Which would show all my open issues for fix version 5.2.3.
fields.summary: Addition of "Fix version" to  Quick Search recognizable tokens
